Application.Repository

Interface MatchRepository

  • All Superinterfaces:
    org.springframework.data.repository.CrudRepository<Match,java.lang.Integer>, org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository<Match,java.lang.Integer>, org.springframework.data.repository.PagingAndSortingRepository<Match,java.lang.Integer>, org.springframework.data.repository.query.QueryByExampleExecutor<Match>, org.springframework.data.repository.Repository<Match,java.lang.Integer>

    public interface MatchRepository
extends org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository<Match,java.lang.Integer>
    An interface to manage the data access to the Match table.
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Corti Lorenzo, Tocchetti Andrea

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Collection<Match> findByUserId(java.lang.String user_id)
      Returns the list of Match(es) played by the User provided their unique identifier.
      java.util.Collection<Match> findByUserIdAllInDepthMatchPlayed(java.lang.String user_id)
      Returns the list of In-depth Match(es) played by the User provided their unique identifier.
      java.util.Collection<Match> findByUserIdAllPlayed(java.lang.String user_id, int scenarioId)
      Returns the list of Match(es) played by the User in a Scenario provided their unique identifiers.
      java.util.Collection<Match> findByUserIdAllQuickMatchPlayed(java.lang.String user_id)
      Returns the list of Quick Match(es) played by the User provided their unique identifier.
      java.util.Optional<Match> findByUserLast(java.lang.String user_id)
      Returns the last Match played by the User provided their unique identifier.

      • findByUserLast

        @Query(value="SELECT * FROM matchmaking WHERE player = :user_id ORDER BY id_match DESC LIMIT 1",
       nativeQuery=true)
java.util.Optional<Match> findByUserLast(@Param(value="user_id")
                                                                                                                                                                   java.lang.String user_id)
        Returns the last Match played by the User provided their unique identifier.
        Parameters:
        user_id - The unique identifier of the User.
        Returns:
        If found, the last Match played by the User provided their unique identifier, null otherwise.
